conclusion: The pedestrian runs at a constant speed to catch up with a bus that has stopped due to a red light.
When the pedestrian reaches a point 36 meters away from the bus, the green light turns on, and the bus starts moving forward with uniform acceleration.
The v-t graph shows the pedestrian moving at a constant speed of 8 m/s.
The v-t graph shows the bus starting from rest and accelerating uniformly.
The pedestrian is still moving at 8 m/s when the bus pulls away.
The bus immediately begins accelerating, so its speed and the gap between them keeps increasing from that instant onward.
At no later time does the pedestrianâ€™s position equal that of the bus.
The pedestrian never catches the bus.
